intro: Psychotria linearisepala var. linearisepala, commonly known as the slender-leaved Psychotria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, known for its diverse and often striking floral structures. The plant typically features elongated, narrow leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with showy, often brightly colored petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical significance lies in its role within ecological systems and its potential ethnobotanical uses.
